Package org.forgerock.openam.authentication.callbacks.helpers

Class PollingWaitSpamChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openam.authentication.callbacks.helpers.PollingWaitSpamChecker
  • public class PollingWaitSpamChecker
extends Object
    The PollingWaitSpamChecker is a tool for verifying that the client using the PollingWait callback is polling at an acceptable interval.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      PollingWaitSpamChecker()
      Default Constructor for the spam checker.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PollingWaitSpamChecker

        public PollingWaitSpamChecker​(long spamGracePeriod,
                              int maxSpamRequest)
        Constructor for the spam checker, setting a custom gr`ce period and strike count.
        Parameters:
        spamGracePeriod - the time within which we call the return call 'close enough' to the current wait period to be considered not spam
        maxSpamRequest - the number of early request we will tolerate before we throw an exception.

      • PollingWaitSpamChecker

        public PollingWaitSpamChecker()
        Default Constructor for the spam checker.

    • Method Detail

      • incrementSpamCheck

        public void incrementSpamCheck()
        increments teh number of hits on this spamChecker

      • isSpammed

        public boolean isSpammed()
        Checks for spam requests. If the caller is following protocol this method will return true. However if the call has been made too many times (but not so many that it triggers a network level DOS block) then it will throw an exception and the authentication module will fail. To avoid this failure pay attention to the wait timeout period returned in the callback object and ensure that this spam checker is
        Returns:
        true if the spam check has detected a spam attempt

      • isWaitLongEnough

        public boolean isWaitLongEnough()
        Determines if the wait period has been long enough to service te request.
        Returns:
        true if the wait request has waited long enough.

      • resetSpamCheck

        public void resetSpamCheck​(long currentWaitPeriod)
        Sets the wait period to base the spamming detection from.
        Parameters:
        currentWaitPeriod - the time period in milliseconds that this spam checker it working against.
